c0ders
 

/**
* c0ders is the story of a group of programmers that work in a small decadent ISP where they try to demonstrate
* everyday how professional they are, but of course without any comprehension of their so called "superiors"
*/

CURRENT-STABLE-RELEASE
Characters Bubble Telekom Old Stories Feedback Links Author
  
  
  
  
  
  

Feedback

Feel free to send your comments, suggestions, ideas, opinions, insults and any kind of colaboration. It will be totally welcomed and I hope that It should be useful for this work. I'll try to respond every email as soon as I can, always with my superior permission because I'm working hard at a ISP ;)

Obviously I can't know everything about programming and programming languages so It's possible that you find formal errors when Peter Class, John Lisp or Float open their mouth; anyway that's is very similar to the real world, It's not unusual that developers talk about technologies that they don't even understand, but they have heard something there or read about It in any slashdot.



 

As you can see, in every strip I try to put the references of the issues that are mentioned. I won't make an exhaustive reference work, lot of them would be very obvious (e.j.: reference to www.perl.com). Using this reference system I expect to give more than a (short) fun moment: to become a useful strip for everyone who likes to learn something new. I hope so.
